How would you format the following sentence in proper APA style? Include the sentence in an [APA formatted paragraph] and cite the source where this research finding was mentioned in the reference list.
"The research findings indicate that nature-based activities can be beneficial for mental health."

To format the sentence in proper APA style within an APA-formatted paragraph, you would integrate the sentence into a paragraph that provides context and proper citation. Here is an example:

---

Engaging in nature-based activities has been increasingly recognized for its positive impact on mental health. According to recent research, these activities can significantly enhance mental well-being by reducing stress and promoting relaxation. The research findings indicate that nature-based activities can be beneficial for mental health (Author Last Name, Year).

---

In this sentence, replace "Author Last Name" with the actual last name of the author(s) and "Year" with the publication year of the source you are citing. The specific details depend on the actual source you are referencing.

In the reference list, you would include the full citation of the source. Here's an example format for a journal article:

Author Last Name, First Initial(s). (Year). Title of the article. *Title of the Journal, Volume*(Issue), page range. DOI or URL

Ensure to replace placeholders with actual details from your source.
